reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: PASSIA - Dialogue and Education for a Continued Palestinian Presence in East Jerusalem

description.narrative: The objectives of this program will be to build on the work of PASSIA hitherto and capitalize on its experience in holding dialogue sessions and educational seminars to accomplish the following main goals:-Provide a forum for open discussion and exchange a nd stimulate debate on topics of concern for Palestinians in Jerusalem.-Build bridges of communication and understanding between Palestinians from different streams of society and their counterparts.-Foster dialogue and facilitate an encounter among people from all kinds of backgrounds. -Provide in-depth educational seminars on various aspects and pressing issues related to Jerusalem.-Build Palestinian capacity to counter the various Israeli approaches and attempts to eliminate the Palestinian presence in t he city.-Foster the role of women in Palestinian society by actively involving them in the proposed activities.-Promote and strengthen the status of East Jerusalem as a Palestinian city.-Empower young Palestinians them to use the resources in place to thei r advantage and develop the skills needed to achieve their goals.-Provide Palestinian activists/professionals with an in-depth look at Jerusalem?s history society economy and political system as well as its culture religions and various identities.-Promote understanding of Palestinian positions and policies regarding Jerusalem both historically and contemporarily.The target audience for this project consists of Palestinian activists and professionals (first and foremost but not only) from Jerusalem.

tag.narrative: Improving democracy in societies is the main priority area in this activity
